snippet: The Dodd-Frank Act requires companies to disclose their use of minerals mined in warring parts of Africa, a challenging task that involves tracking long and disjointed supply chains.
abstract: American companies are struggling to comply with provision in Dodd-Frank Act requiring them to disclose their use of minerals mined in war-torn regions across Africa; task can be daunting, especially for companies that are halfway around the world; list compiled by Tulane University researchers ranks companies on their compliance with law.
lead_paragraph: The Dodd-Frank Act requires companies to disclose their use of minerals mined in warring parts of Africa, a challenging task that involves tracking long and disjointed supply chains.

headline.main: Companies Struggle to Comply With Rules on Conflict Minerals
